body: Instead replace them with fprintf and printf.

comment_data.body: we can clean up all callsites with static strings like these, just `fprintf(stderr, e_outofmem)` would work. Although right here we might want `fprintf(stderr, "%s\n",  e_outofmem)` .  (imagine being able to actually use printf when writing to stdio lol)
also in cases like this. gettext formatstring is used anyway in a lot of other places.

This message is translated, so I think it's better to make it a format argument.
```suggestion
      fprintf(stderr, "%s", _("Cannot open for script output: \""));
```

ditto
```suggestion
    fprintf(stderr, "%s", _("E970: Failed to initialize lua interpreter\n"));
```

ditto
```suggestion
    fprintf(stderr, "%s", _("E970: Failed to initialize builtin lua modules\n"));
```

```suggestion
  info_message = true;  // use stdout, not stderr
```

```suggestion
  info_message = true;  // use stdout, not stderr
```

```suggestion
    info_message = true;        // use stdout, not stderr
```

```suggestion
    info_message = false;       // use stdout, not stderr
```

```suggestion
  info_message = true;          // use stdout, not stderr
```
